text: <http://thenextweb.com/apple/2016/03/18/study-shows-chrome-beats-safari-ios-maybe-not-long/> via @thenextweb

attachments.title: Chrome beats Safari on mobile, but not for long
attachments.text: An Adobe study shows Chrome is beating Safari up on iOS, but users like Safari better. The days of Chrome's dominance may be coming to an end.
attachments.fallback: The Next Web: Chrome beats Safari on mobile, but not for long

text: I believe Chrome on iOS is waaaay diff. from Chrom on Android devices. Everything on iOS is forced to use the Safari renderer underneath, so Chrome on iOS would have same video limitations.
Trying to see if iOS 10 brought along any changes
Looks like we CAN grab a thumbnail of selected video on iOS 10 Safari <https://codepen.io/aertmann/pen/mAVaPx>

attachments.title: Video and image thumbnail for HTML file upload
attachments.fallback: CodePen: Video and image thumbnail for HTML file upload

text: chrome on ios uses safari webkit underpinning, yes
also this: <https://github.com/bfred-it/iphone-inline-video> looks like it’s possible now

attachments.title: bfred-it/iphone-inline-video
attachments.text: iphone-inline-video - :iphone: Make videos playable inline on the iPhone (prevents automatic fullscreen)

text: for inline playback
silently only
it has other functionality around network management and google functionality, but rendering should be similar
you shouldn’t need a node module for that tho
any <video> tag with no audio or muted audio should autoplay, and display inline vs fullscreen if properly tagged
i don’t know if those new policies extend to ios chrome though and would not be surprised if they didnt
good call. i think module is to make it work on ios 8/9. not sure those versions matter anymore
ohhhh, ios 10 added the inline silent autoplay policy i believe
<https://mixpanel.com/trends/#report/ios_10>

attachments.text: Learn how people use your app with the world's most advanced mobile & web analytics. Try it for free.

text: we need audio tho
you can’t autoplay video with audio on ios
right, so for our purposes it sounds like we still need a video-less fallback option
which is fine since that’s what we decided
but still, good to know the limitations and expanded functionality
yeah, for future: it doesn’t have to be silent, can be muted, and unmute on click for instance
ah gotcha.  so we could use inline video...

as long as we’re comfortable doing it
i think - i’m reading thru the spec now seems it supports the design
i mentioned it in the client project slack, but i think ziba folks should be msged directly. i think we should do it w/ caveat that it won’t play any sound until user interaction.
would like to prototype it today
good resource: <https://webkit.org/blog/6784/new-video-policies-for-ios/>

best lead-in image

i would love to have eyes on it!

ok <@U06DFL7BP> i’ll fwd it on to you
thanks
i am happy to test and am real good at breaking shit and documenting how
word up i will likely take you up on that
i think we’ll have to play it by ear since it’s hinging on our ability to get everything up on the wf aws stack, which <@U1S5GKTHQ> is gonna be working on next couple days
but ideally we’d test some stuff friday morning so if there’s anything groundbreaking we can look into getting it fixed or deal with it then
the native iOS fullscreen controls don’t accept touch events, so you can’t unmute on fullscreen but
you can unmute THEN fullscreen
currently tied this to just a general click on video, but could create other custom fullscreen UI elements to do the same
<https://nostalgic-wyrm.gomix.me>
tested on ios 10 only :neutral_face:
i will stop now
thanks <@U06DFL7BP>! really helpful. nice how simple this is. i was expecting a battle.
it will require some custom UI tho, so designers beware (and some decisions about like, unmuting in situ, or pausing on minimize, etc)
